description: You are given a 0-indexed integer array nums having length n, and an integer k. You can perform the following increment operation any number of times (including zero): An array is considered beautiful if, for any subarray with a size of 3 or more, its maximum element is greater than or equal to k. Return an integer denoting the minimum number of increment operations needed to make nums beautiful. A subarray is a contiguous non-empty sequence of elements within an array.
